												I just gave this game a try since it pretends to be an "open-world driving game", and that got me curious. Alas, after just over one hour of trying to come to grips with it, I have to admit I give up on it. It's not an awfully bad game, far from it. The graphics are more than decent, considering it's a game from 2009. On the highest settings (not that there are that many settings...), the cars look nice and the environment is more or less ok - bar the awful pop-ups in front of you of several objects. The driving model is fair, nothing special, but when played with a controller it feels fine. The music, as so often with this type of game, is all too repetitive for my taste so I switched it almost immediately off. There are some possibilities for adding your own music tracks to the game, so for those interested in this, the game offers something extra.The bad thing about the game is the "gameplay" - actually, there hardly is any, at least I did not find much of it. There are several modes: a free patrol mode, in which I searched in vain for anything to-do other than driving through a generic-looking city with roadsigns that kept saying "Köln 2300m" all the time. You can do a normal city race, which is fine for just a quick try, but the "story mode" is what lets the game down. The various objectives are simply hilariously difficult - most of the time one has to damage an opponent to 100%, but whenever he gets further away than 200m, the mission has to be restarted. Since the AI miraculously can teleport itself down bridges or through walls, this got me first staring in disbelief and then lauging out loud. I guess this game can be fun to some, but to me it's a no-go: there are simply too many other good games out there, including large-scale racing games, to put any more time into this.Overall score: 3.5/10

												This game materialized in my library one day. I never purchased it, it was just there. I installed it out of boredom and expected the game to be no better than those "X SIMULATOR" games you see here on Steam. I was pleasantly mistaken, because this game, despite being made on an almost non-existent budget, is surprisingly solid. What the game lacks in originality, presentation, and innovation, it makes up for with solid controls, and really great vehicle physics. There's a fair amount of attention to detail here, too. Your car, and every other car in the game as well, can be absolutely smashed into an ugly mess, with way more convincing looking damage than what GTA IV and V have to offer. You can park in front of a train, let it smash your car's front grille in, go flying, land, and not be able to control your car at all because your front wheels are now several feet away racing eachother down the autobahn without you. The gameplay is pretty generic and repetitive, but still solid. You'll get bored eventually, but until then you'll have fun chasing criminals, smashing into everything, and racing. Traffic will move the ♥♥♥♥ out of your way when you turn on your sirens, and when you finally catch up to the bad guys and P.I.T. them into a wall, you'll have to hold them still there for a few seconds in order to "arrest" them. There's things to collect and vehicles to unlock, including an excavator and a massive armored personnel carrier with six wheels, which absolutely smashes everything out of its way including buses and large trucks, even in oncoming traffic. All of the cars are unlicensed rip-offs of real world vehicles, which I'm glad the developers managed to do. It's not a BMW, it's a Semir! They're different! We swear!All in all, it's a solid game. It's not the best game in the world, but it's definitely not bad either. It's just decent. A 5/10, or I guess 7.5/10 if you go by IGN's rating system. If you like racing and police chase games, and don't mind games with low budgets, pick this one up on sale.The developers of this game, sadly, stopped making video games in 2014. They were very well known in Germany, but virtually nobody knows about them outside of Germany. They specialized in racing games and their games were some of the best selling games to come out of Germany. Rest in peace Synetic, and if you guys are reading this, I loved World Racing 2 on the Xbox.

												Crash Time 2 is a series of games based on the German police drama "Alarm for Cobra 11: Autobahn Police". There was actually several games made under the Cobra 11 brand, then came Cobra 11 Nitro. However, none of these was exported. Next version, Cobra 11: Crash Time was exported  as "Crash Time", and that lead to the Crash Time II, and so on. (We're now up to Crash Time V). At its heart, Crash Time is an open-world mission-based driving sim with a fictional city for you to drive around in using variety of vehicles. CT2 has a good selection of German vehicles, none with actual names and logos, but they are readily recognizable, plus a few favorite foreign cars. The graphics are actually quite good, giving the amount of detail available for the cities and buildings. Some multilevel garages can be driven to the roof and back down via the spiral ramps. the Autobahns are nice and wide with plenty of places to speed, and many cars have nitrous injection added for that extra burst of power. The mission, on the other hand, are your typical police chase (either stop the car or crash him into toally disabled), checkpoint race (reach X checkpints, stop for 1 second in each), getaway (don't let the bad guys catch you), time trial (reach the destination via specified route before time runs out). CT2, however, added "jumping puzzles", where you must take the ramp at certain speeds to ensure you jump correctly onto certain locations in order to do something you can't do otherwise. And sometimes you need to chain the driving and jumping together, and that is just ridiculous. For example, one of the missions was "stop that barge from dumping waste into the canal" How do you do it? By taking ramps and JUMPING onto the barge (without falling into the canal, of course). That requires jumping across the canel, landing on the other side, make a left, jump ANOTHER ramp, then stop right on top of the barge (without falling off). All in... 45 seconds. ARGH! The city is large enough and open enough that "free roam" is quite possible Indeed, you are encouraged to "patrol" the city for missions to advance the campaign. Though in reality you just need to respawn at the regular start spots and few times, and/or scroll around the city map (fully zoomable in 3D!) for a "red arrow" which means mission starting point. Handling of the cars are simplified, and are exciting without being overly difficult. The campaign missions, however, have the dubious honor of having some of the WORST English dubbing done EVER in a game. The two voice actors are either very bored or acting too hard. Though this seem to reflect the type of TV show this was based on: more of action comedy than pure action. If you can find this game cheap, it is worth a try at least. It's not NFS: Hot Pursuit, but it has its own charms.

												Crash Time 2 is a very enjoyable game. It's not without bugs, but I think the experience is certainly fun enough to warrant fighting through those.Visually, it's fantastic, and I had no framerate issues at all running with max graphics on my GTX760 (1680x1050 fullscreen). If the opponent's car happens to respawn behind you, that means it will likely turn around and drive the other way. I recommend doing your best to not flip over the cars or completely pin them where they can't move. Just keep hitting them with force or get them behind you then keep bumping them as they try to pass you.- Sometimes, it's just plain hard to find a mission. You drive around for a while and nothing appears. In these cases, try switching cars (look for ones with mission indicators), and try switching starting locations. You shouldn't ever need to be driving around for more than a minute for the mission brief to play, so keep moving about until a mission appears. Annoying, but workable.- The navigation arrow is absolutely useless sometimes. It will recommend jumps over bridges when your car isn't fast enough to make the jump. Fortunately, the mini-map has a much better direction indicator that adjusts for different routes and recommends shortcuts. I highly recommend using that primarily (even though you have to look off the screen a bit).

The buyer, who has not played this game before and has the equipment and money to play most modern-ish gamesThis game has its good moments, but it really has nothing unique that you wouldn't find anywhere else. If you're still interested in this bad-comedy-action type racing game, may I suggest later titles from this franchise.2. The nostalgia buyerYou might be pretty tempted to buy this old 'gem', especially since its price gets pretty darn low on sales. Before you add this to your cart, let me just mention some of the issues I encountered:*I don't remember the non-Steam version having frequent framerate issues. This does. Most notably on the edges of the map, but they happen pretty much all over the place. And I don't mean drops by just a couple of frames. I'm talking about motion sickness level nosedives.*Speaking of frame rates, I averaged about 38-40 fps, with 1920x1080 resolution and all other graphics settings on the lowest possible setting. I don't know if that's a sign that this port is badly optimized or that my computer is sh*ttier than I had previously thought. For reference, I can play project cars on medium settings with the same resolution and almost never go below 60fps. Not really an issue other than I'm a bit spoilt.*You still have to grind through the bland story missions to gain access to the good cars*In my case, it didn't really provide the entertainment I thought it was going to deliver. After 10 hours you've completely depleted the game and it has nothing more to offer you. That doesn't mean I didn't have fun, but the framerate issues were the things that killed it for me.Ultimately, it's your choice..3. The buyer, who has not played this before, but can't really run or afford any better quality alternativesI think the story and voice acting are irrelevant to this type of game. Sure they are bad, but I think it was intentional. It would be worse, if they tried to make it serious and ultimately failed at that. And it's not even that annoying. Besides, you should be able to skip most dialogue. Anyway, you are realistically buying this for the action stuff, and as far as that is concerned, it is very solid. Some cars are even a joy to drive. Great for creating low budget action sequences, if that's a thing you're interested in. And when it costs under a euro, it's a steal. Would recommend.Thus ends the review

												The first thing that you must keep in mind if you have purchased this game ( or got for free ) is that you didn't spend a whole lot of money for it. For this, you will be Thankful ; you do get what you pay for. Don't expect a Burnout Series game level of development and gameplay. If you want a ' quality ' game, be prepared to pay the premium and scroll past Crash Time 2.The game is based on a German TV show called ' Alarm für Cobra 11 – Die Autobahnpolizei Ausfahrt ', a TV show that I cannot figure out as to whether or not is a serious crime drama or a German spoof take on the 80's series, Miami Vice. If you are from an English speaking country, the TV show that it is based on looks really really bad ( I did some youtube research by watching a couple of episodes to try and better understand what this game is based on )Graphics :  I haven't seen a PC game since that late 90's that has such a short draw distance and pop in. You can actually see the grass grow as you drive by embankments. The developers must have heard ' Bloom ' and ' HDR  ' and thought ' you mean ' Glare ' as that is what you get. Glare then translates to making the screen bright white in some areas. The plus to this level of techincal wizardry is that you don't need an i7 and a pair of Titans to play this game. The specs required to play this game are from around 2003 i.e. if you are reading this review, your computer can run the game. Yes there are some slow downs, but in general, it's not a bad frame rate for a 2003 standard driving game. Unlicensed cars which are very obviously actual BMW, Mercedes, VW's, etc. The cars are not bad at all, hence why you can actually tell what they are based on ( or not badged as ). The city is well, German ( industrial, efficient and logically laid out but a little bland  ; mostly built in the last 70 years onwards due a disagreement with a couple of countries a number of years ago ).  Graphics wise, not the worst - not the best - kinda ' Eh ' if you can forgive the HDR ( or lack of ) and pop in that is.Gameplay : Hmmm. You have a car and can drive around - really enough said. The ' handling ' is an arcade racer, not a sim. Don't expect fantastic drifts, just understeer and poor brakes. I tend to use the handbrake instead of the normal brakes for stopping. The nearest driving experience would be if CrazyTaxi had a love child with an early TOCA game. The story is as deep as a standard cup of water but hey, you either paid $0.99 or got this game for free right?Voice acting : Voice acting needs a special mention all of it's own. You need to play the game to understand where I am coming from around this. I have NEVER heard such bad voice acting from ANY game, TV show, telemarketing scammer, etc. When I first heard the characters, it was quite amusing. As the game went on, it becomes, well a little bit creepy. Ever heard a 6 year old in a school play? Well it's a bit like that but spoken by a 40 plus year old guy.  Why really bad English accents? Why not German's speaking English? I think this would have worked better ( and they could have slipped in the word Squirrel for bonus points ) .... You have been warned. Controls :  I have read some reviews on this game that say that the controls are difficult. I did not experience this problem as I plugged in my generic USB gamepad AKA PS2 copy and configured to suit a PS2 layout. You MUST use the D Pad to control the menu up and down then use the top button to select ( Triangle for PS2 ) and circle equivalent ( PS2 ) to go back. If you use the keyboard at any point on the menu, the game pad will be disabled. It's really not very hard to figure out though. To configure, enter the control lay out menu and set the control for the button of your choice ( press enter on the keyboard, then the button on the game pad that you want to use for that control ). For those that have configured a DOS / Windows 95/98 game pad, it's back to those days. Once configured, controls were responsive and worked as you want them to.Conclusion :  Reading the above you are probably wondering why I am recommending this game? The fact remains that it is a very cheap ( or Free )  FULL game with graphics that exceed homebrew games. Buy it, but don't expect Burnout Paradise for $0.99c or Free. If you want Burnout Paradise, then don't be so cheap and buy it ( or wait for a Steam Sale 75% off ).Note that support for the game was ditched after about a year from release, but likely not for the reason that Apple use to ditch support to sell you another product ( though we are upto Crash time 5 according to the interweb )

If the scenario makes your partner jump into a truck while you keep steady near it.... he just stays in the car, even though supposedly he is driving a truck now, even though he is still riding shotgun with you. 												I have over 500 games in my Steam account, and the vast majority of them are still unplayed. So now I'm dedicating an hour to each of these games and writing a series of One Hour Reviews. An hour isn't very long to judge a game on, so think of this as more of a first impression, and take this review in the spirit in which it's given. Be sure to read other reviews from players who have spent more time in the game. One Hour Reviews #34 - Crash Time IISo the Oxford dictionary added janky to their list of words this year.janky (adj.): of extremely poor or unreliable quality.And it just so happens that janky sums up Crash Time 2 very nicely.I start, like with many games, by trying out the Tutorial.  So I'm start with a mission where I have to pursuit and stop a car.  Okay, sound simple enough.  In fact, I very quickly pin the car against a fence, and render it completely immobile.  Oh wait, apparently the game didn't expect me to do that so soon, so instead of giving me credit for stopping the car, it disappears and then respawns.  Now I have to chase it down again.Eventually I chase it down and this time I look long enough that the game rewarded me for it.  In the next part of the tutorial,  I have to chase the car again, except this time I have to ram it to do enough damage to stop it.  So I start ramming the car, and eventually I make the car flip over.  Awesome, I win, right?  Oh wait, no, instead of getting credit for stopping the car, the game just makes the car respawn.  Apparently it wants me to keep ramming the car.  Apparently this game equates thinking outside the box with cheating.So after ramming my way to victory, next I'm on a mission where it tells me to hit the "Action Button" to launch a remote control drone.  It doesn't tell me which button on the controller that is, it just says "Action Button" like it's obvious.  I proceeded to mash every single button my controller and none of them worked.  Oh wait, I forgot to push down on my thumbsticks.  There we go, the action button was apparently mapped to pushing down on the right thumbstick.  Totally my first choice for an "action button", and not those pesky X or A buttons.  So now that I've figured out how to hit the action button, it spawns what looks like a stick of dynamite on wheels.  Now I'm controlling a remote control drone.  I then drive it to my target and hit the "Action Button" again and blow it up.  Now I'm back in my car and it wants me to launch another drone.  Okay, so now as I am driving this other drone I have to hit this jump just right, and it will launch me over a fence to my target.  Well I wasn't going fast enough so I end up vertical against the fence.  Now I can't get myself off the fence.  I hit a bunch of different buttons, trying to get back into my car instead of the drone.  I hit the back button and sure enough I'm back in my car.  Except I didn't go back to my car, the game teleported the car to me.  So now I'm in my car stuck vertically on the fence.  I do eventually get through tutorial and decide to try and actual game.  So I pick the option to Patrol and get a mission where I have to go to the harbor to escort a car that's being delivered.  So I start by driving towards the harbor as directed.  But then as I get part way towards the harbor, suddenly my screen is black, well most of my screen anyway.  The UI is there, including my speedometer and minimap, but there's no longer a road.  Apparently I'm supposed to drive to the harbor blindfolded.


Driving to the harbor blindfolded 
A Screenshot of Crash Time II
By: EvilSpaniard




I restart the mission and this time it lets me make it to the harbor without blindfolding me.  So now I'm escorting this truck.  The truck has the prototype car in it, and in turn 2 cop cars are escorting the truck.  So I have to follow the truck from behind, but not too close, and not too far either.  I guess I'm like the undercover backup that no one is supposed to know about.  So I follow the truck for a little ways and 2 vans drive up and start taking out the cop cars.  I better help those poor cops, so I floor it to catch up.  Oh wait, that would be common sense.  I forget this game doesn't reward me for common sense because I'm breaking the rules, because now I'm too close to the truck.  Nevermind the mortal danger here, I'm outpacing the games scripting, and we can't have that.I can just picture this conversation where the publisher warns the developers of this game, "Hey guys, the game is coming along, but it could really use some polish".  Except the developers misunderstood and made all of the cars in the game shiny.   Unfortunately, no amount of shine could possibly cover over this janky turd of a game.

												Not worth your time. Doesn't live up to the name. It is not about crashing or damaging cars, it's about conducting boring routine tasks as a german police officer. First and foremost, the car models are quite well done, with excellent graphics for the time it came out. Apparently that is where the studio spent all their time and money. The game honestly feels like a graphical showpiece for car modeling. Besides the cars, the environments look blocky and bad. The gameplay also suffers. The worst offender is the car driving, as I can't remember driving mechanics so poor. Your small boring generic sedan, which is basically the only car you drive during the game, handles like a boat. Turns are taken terribly, and breaking seems to take forever to slow down. There is no handbreak or way to take quick turns, which means turning basically means slowing down to a complete stop then slowly turning. Backing up doesn't work either. Once you've stopped you press break and it changes you to reverse, then you need to let off the button and press it again to start backing up. There is no way to look at controls in game. I had no idea what anything did. I tried looking for a handbrake, and there seemed to be 2 different ones, but once didn't turn you faster, it only flung your forward at an angle for some reason when you were slowing down. There is no way to look behind you, which you actually need to do in the game, so I have no idea why they wouldn't include it. You have to use this tiny unhelpful rearview mirror. Then there is the gameplay. The single player makes no sense and isn't untuitive. There is a case, single race, and patrol at multiple different locations - tabs. Apparently you just select a patrol with a flag and then drive around and wait to get a call, which makes no sense for a single player. The voice acting may be the worst and cheesiest I've ever heard. Missions have multiple parts, but if you fail 2/3 in you have to start from the beginning for no reason. This is easy because if you get spun around or accidentally hit the wrong turn, as is common with the terrible direction indicator on your small map, or you get stuck behind the tiny railing that you can't get through (logic?) and you are following someone, you will fall behind the certain distance. Then there are the parts you have to break a car to win. You are a cop but you have no gadgets or guns to help you, all you can do is crash into cars........sounds like the plan of no cop ever. Destroying vehicles takes forever because damage modeling makes no sense, and you only do tiny damage at a time. I flipped a car over 3 times within 30 seconds and he would just drive off with no damage to the top or side of his car. It never makes sense how the cars get damaged. So you have to destroy a car but it literally takes 7 minutes of you following it around hitting it, having no idea how far you are in destroying it, because it never changes in performance. Then there are missions that have you drive to certain spots to check things out, but instead of 3-4 spots, the game has you go to FOURTEEN spots, which should take about 12-15 min, for no reason but to inflate length and give you busy work. That isn't fun because the random german city is boring and generic looking, with nothing interesting to look at. There is really nothing to make this game worth playing. Good vehicle graphics though, even if they are super un-interesting to use or look at. 4/10.

												Crash Time 2 is an odd mix, but very enjoyable as a driving simulator for cruising around in the depicted german town. I'll preface by saying that I haven't played more than a few missions, but have spent hours cruising around.You get the brief impression from loading the game that it may have been re-branded from a more conventional german road driving simulator, but it almost liberates the player from taking their time on the road too seriously. The voice actors continue this first impression, causing the gamer to question exactly what subliminal german propaganda is being pumped through their speakers - because clearly, it can't be that superficial.. Yet, for all of its faults, there are plenty of great qualities. 1. The graphics are still nice and shiny on newer directX releases, and it holds up well over the span of 5 years - a virtual eternity, so to speak.2. The almost apathetic mixture of citizens and police driving around makes for some catastrophic crashes while business as usual goes on around them. 3. The driving itself, while not exactly precise in terms of the on-the-road handling physics, is pretty fun. It maintains a good balance between lively handling and classic arcade driving. The chases are a little easy if we're honest, but the crashes make it worthwhile.4. The comedy gold. If you start to look at the voice acting less as an actual attempt to create a dramatic environment and more of a strange video game cameo of mystery science theater 3000 post-translation, you'll be able to appreciate the rich social commentary presented between the lines. Bonus points for trying to drive with no front wheels, just a stream of sparks originating from your low-speed collision.5. The damage contest. While it's not a great idea when you're racing, one of the best parts of the game is seeing just how much property damage you can rack up before "The engine exploded."..4. Being $2.49 on sale occasionally. Very, very hard to complain about that.In short, if you come into the game expecting more than flat-out level driving performance, you'll probably be a little underwhelmed. But, if you load it up just to drive around and have a little fun driving like a maniac without the GTA-style shooting, it's a great way to mindlessly pass a few hours!

												I don't normally review games unless I wanna give my two cents but this game? I have to, it's mixed review rate just isn't right. That being said, let's actually review this game and the whole one hour I put into it.I know one hour doesn't seem like much but to me it was enough to review most of this game.This game is like a weird mix of Burnout and GTA without being able to get out of your vehicles, it's a lot like Starsky and Hutch for the PS2 minus the guns, that game was a blast with a steering wheel and light gun. c:I bought this game for $0.99 and just recently saw it was a giveaway by Bundle Stars so I put it on my family account as well so my family could play it and it also reminded me that I should give it a try and I did.The actual review: Pros:+Semi-realistic vehicle handling and physics.+Ability to use warning indicators and turn signals as well as your siren and lights and silent police lights(No siren.).+Decent damage system.+You can pretty much destroy everything on a city wide rampage in the semi with a trailer.+Cheesy voice acting.+Great looking for being 6-7 years old.+Tons of video options and resolutions.+Great input support, works with all my gamepads and of course an X360 pad and I believe it has steering wheel support.+Stable, never crashed on me once and it runs great.+Splitscreen racing.+Manual and Automatic settings, gear shifting and more.+Fun to slam AI around during missions that warrant it.Cons:-Sometimes terrible AI and the AI spawn system is completely borked, AI will spawn miles away from you sometimes in a mission where you have to be within a few metres of them and thus causes you to fail and must restart the mission from the beginning, there are no checkpoints but most missions are pretty short. So try not to flip AI vehicles as a sort of fix.-Cheesy voice acting, not completely a negative, it's sometimes pretty hilarious listening to the voice actors putting on fake accents and faking feeling and integrity in their lines.-Not much depth to the game or story, but this game isn't really about story as it is gameplay.-Some AI is incredibly difficult to take down and may take up to twenty minutes to take down a single car smaller and slower than your vehicle which is kind of realistic but also kind of annoying if you just want to be done with the mission.-No online multiplayer and no splitscreen/online free roam/co-op.Overall, my final verdict would be 7/10, the game has bad voice acting and poopy AI at times but the game is still rather fun especially to go on a rampage and destroy anything and everything. This game has been so far extremely solid for me, no FPS drops, no crashing and everything is maxed on my system while maintaining at least 60FPS at all times.My suggestion: Wait until this game is like $3 or cheaper to purchase. It's mostly just one of those fun games to go back to and basically drive around destroying everything, taking out bad guys or leisurely strolling around and going with the flow of traffic and following road signs, etc.

												Got it for cheap. Went into it expecting an unironically bad game, got an ironically good game instead. I didn't even know it was based off of a TV show.Pros:- You have almost absolute control over your vehicle and beyond. Everything from blinkers to nitro boosters to camera angles to slow motion. (I found even the keyboard controls to be acceptable, but I do recommend an Xbox 360 controller.) AI will sometimes respond to your vehicle's behavior. Damage can range from a smashed bumper to a popped tire to engine failure.- Best handling cars I've ever controlled in a game. Each one has its own strengths and weaknesses, and there are quite a bit to drive. Even with the huge variety, I rarely find myself losing control of any vehicle. This contributes to the feeling of the game feeling like an actual challenge, instead of feeling like I've been forced to drive a gimped vehicle.- Decent graphics. Some of it looks akward, such as the lack of civilians, and the building pop-in from the skyboxes. The chromatic aberration was a good call, and the texture detail is agreeable. I especially like the cows who explode into steak with a single touch.Cons:- Sometimes hard to figure out where to go and what to do. I've wasted a bit of time during and between missions searching on the internet for what I need to do to progress, as the game often does not explain it well enough. I didn't know how to start a mission or what button I needed to press to detonate a drone, before looking through outside sources. The minimap also fits into this category. It does not show all of the roads, and often suggests a longer path that wastes more time.- Some of the missions suffer from strange design. It's hard to explain, there are so many different things, but I'll take an example: The Poisoned Beer mission. All you have to do it pull up next to the truck and hold that position for a few seconds to get it to stop. I mean, I get it, I've beaten it, I've done that mission several times. It doesn't matter if you beat him to the supermarket or are just a few seconds late, you fail if you don't do that. Does that really conform to logic? If a truck smashed my there-and-waiting police car out of the way to park behind the market, would I really say "Uh-oh, guess I didn't get there in time?"- The voice actors for the main characters are terrible. It's localization at its worst. It's so bad that it makes the rest of the voice acting sound good.Meh:- The music might as well not exist. It's not terrible, but I don't think it adds anything either. It can be turned off if you want.- Again, localization. Except for the voice acting, it's not horrific, but even changing the text language does not change the spoken language, so you're kind of screwed either way in that department. Also, there's a lot of German signage to notice during the game, some of which can be pretty amusing.Overall, the game is pretty good, or at least, better than I would have been previously lead to believe.Now, I must make my ausfahrt... I mean, exit.

												I don't normally review games unless I wanna give my two cents but this game? I have to, it's mixed review rate just isn't right. That being said, let's actually review this game and the whole one hour I put into it.I know one hour doesn't seem like much but to me it was enough to review most of this game.This game is like a weird mix of Burnout and GTA without being able to get out of your vehicles, it's a lot like Starsky and Hutch for the PS2 minus the guns, that game was a blast with a steering wheel and light gun. c:I bought this game for $0.99 and just recently saw it was a giveaway by Bundle Stars so I put it on my family account as well so my family could play it and it also reminded me that I should give it a try and I did.The actual review: Pros:+Semi-realistic vehicle handling and physics.+Ability to use warning indicators and turn signals as well as your siren and lights and silent police lights(No siren.).+Decent damage system.+You can pretty much destroy everything on a city wide rampage in the semi with a trailer.+Cheesy voice acting.+Great looking for being 6-7 years old.+Tons of video options and resolutions.+Great input support, works with all my gamepads and of course an X360 pad and I believe it has steering wheel support.+Stable, never crashed on me once and it runs great.+Splitscreen racing.+Manual and Automatic settings, gear shifting and more.+Fun to slam AI around during missions that warrant it.Cons:-Sometimes terrible AI and the AI spawn system is completely borked, AI will spawn miles away from you sometimes in a mission where you have to be within a few metres of them and thus causes you to fail and must restart the mission from the beginning, there are no checkpoints but most missions are pretty short. So try not to flip AI vehicles as a sort of fix.-Cheesy voice acting, not completely a negative, it's sometimes pretty hilarious listening to the voice actors putting on fake accents and faking feeling and integrity in their lines.-Not much depth to the game or story, but this game isn't really about story as it is gameplay.-Some AI is incredibly difficult to take down and may take up to twenty minutes to take down a single car smaller and slower than your vehicle which is kind of realistic but also kind of annoying if you just want to be done with the mission.-No online multiplayer and no splitscreen/online free roam/co-op.Overall, my final verdict would be 7/10, the game has bad voice acting and poopy AI at times but the game is still rather fun especially to go on a rampage and destroy anything and everything. This game has been so far extremely solid for me, no FPS drops, no crashing and everything is maxed on my system while maintaining at least 60FPS at all times.My suggestion: Wait until this game is like $3 or cheaper to purchase. It's mostly just one of those fun games to go back to and basically drive around destroying everything, taking out bad guys or leisurely strolling around and going with the flow of traffic and following road signs, etc.
